alert.note: Alert for Malheur County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:39PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Malheur County through 530 PM PDT... At 439 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Swamp Creek Buttes, or 41 miles northwest of Rome, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Crowley around 550 PM MDT. Turnbull Mountain and Monumental Rock around 600 PM MDT. Copeland Butte and Cedar Mountain around 620 PM MDT. Knottingham Butte around 630 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM PDT for southeastern Oregon.
